name: Angkor Pearl Hotel

reviews.text: Sam is available as a driver/guide from the Angkor Pearl Hotel. If you want a great driver then you cannot do better than Sam - we hired him all day for the days we were in Siem Reap and we could not have found a better man for the job. Sam is friendly and very safe - he knows the temple complex well and knows all the right spots for those incredible sunrises and sunsets - I highly recommend him for all your travel needs whilst in Siem Reap - he can also take you to the better agents for booking ongoing trips - his English is excellent - we were certainly 2 very happy customers. samtuktuk@yahoo.com - or ask at the desk in the hotel.
reviews.title: Sam TukTuk - best driver/tour guide in Siem Reap

reviews.text: From start to finish, my trip in Siem Riep couldn't have been better and I owe it all in part to the friendly, helpful staff at Angkor Pearl. They arranged a tuk tuk driver to pick myself and my friends up from the airport, a glimpse into our authentic Cambodia experience. All the workers were very well versed in English and willing to help at the drop of a hat. Its centralized location made it super easy and accessible to get out and tour Siem Riep. Pub street, where all the bars, nightclubs, and the lively Cambodian market is located, is only minutes away from Angkor Pearl.
reviews.title: For the money conscious tourist wanting to experience Siem Riep there is no better option than Angkor Pearl!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The same tuk tuk driver gave us a tour of Angkor Wat at little to no cost. The amenities all worked, the AC blew fresh, cold air, the sheets were crisp and clean and the beds were comfortable. If I had to do it all over again, I wouldn't change a thing. Thank you so much to Angkor Pearl and its staff for making my stay such a memorable one.
reviews.title: Simply a Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for the Siem Reap leg of our honeymoon. I booked this hotel because of rave reviews I read over here on TripAdvisor. And I must say that I loved every minute of it.
reviews.title: Excellent Location - An Outstanding Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were picked up from the bus station by our tuktuk driver, Sam, who also worked with the hotel. He was a welcome sight after a 14++ hour bus trip from HCMC (the Phnom Penh to Siem Reap was a hell of a trip, but that's another story). He took our bags and made sure that we were very comfortable, after seeing us looking really tired and weary. It was about 9pm and we told him that we were famished--we said we wanted to eat in the hotel and rest for the rest of the night. So, once inside the hotel, he took the menu from the hotel restaurant and handed it to us. He put our bags up our room and made sure everything was OK. The pick up, btw, was complimentary of the hotel. What a welcome!
reviews.title: Best Hotel
Great location, spacious rooms, excellent service
reviews.text: We enjoyed a 2 night stay in the Angkor Pearl Hotel during our trip to SE Asia, the hotel is in what seems a bit of a back alley, but inside it's very spacious, clean and quite elegant. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and the room very large and with a nice comfy bed.

reviews.title: Great location and price for those on a budget
reviews.text: Tried the breakfast as well, and some cocktails and other items off the menu, and everything was very tasty, and cheap! Also it's in a great location near the main road in Siem Reap, so easy access to the city center with it's amazing restaurants, but also easy to get to Angkor Wat, be it by car or bike.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, great tuk tuk driver named Sam
reviews.text: All in all an excellent bargain hotel choice!

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Even Better Driver
reviews.text: This hotel is perfect for those looking to stay in a budget hotel. It's really nice and clean, and would say it's by far way above average compared to other budget hotels I have stayed at in South East Asia. The location is great, only 10 mins away from Pub Street & night market. The staff is very friendly, and helpful. They have a great manager who will make sure your room is reserved, and have someone there to pick you up from the Airport/Bus Stop. I had a great Tuk Tuk driver (sam) who spoke English very well. He's use to live in the states, so It was great to have someone I can understand. He's very organized, and put together a great plan to see the best temples in one day. Make sure you ask him to take you to see the the sun rise.

reviews.title: Sam "I Can" Tuk Tuk
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights in Jan 2011. We quite enjoyed our stay.

I first discovered Angkor Pearl in March 2010. Ever since then, this is the only hotel I will stay at whenever I come to Siem Reap, and the only hotel I recommend to friends. I have stayed here on 4 occasions now, and I have no complaints. Actually, it gets better every time. There are more suites, wider food selection, bigger bar, beautiful decor, and experienced staff. This last time I stayed in the honeymoon suite just to pamper myself. =) It was absolutely gorgeous, spacious, super cozy, and still very affordable! It gets harder to leave every time. Love this place!
reviews.title: Officially my home away from home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed three nights there and we loved it!!! Everyone was more than respectful and went of their way to make to you feel comfortable. Everyone was full of smiles and always willing to help in any way. I have stayed in Siem Reap before but have payed way more for not as good quality of service or room. It is truly a beautiful hotel and near so many neat places to explore. We ate there as well and the food was excellent! I highly recommend this hotel. You just can't beat the price either.. Loved it and plan on staying there every time I visit Siem Reap from now on!!!
reviews.title: Great Experience can't wait to go back!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Stayed in Siem Reap for 4 days and had a blast. During the day I spent my time exploring the wonders of Angkor Wat and after all the sightseeing, it felt really good to come back to a hotel like Angkor Pearl. I was treated like a king, the staff was very professional and welcoming, as if they really felt privileged to have me there. The hotel was extremely clean, the food was great, and in the morning it was hard to get out of bed. My bed was so comfortable, I could have stayed in bed the whole time I was there. While I was there, I also got a chance to meet the owners. Great people, they were really humble and really cared if i had any problems which I don't really remember having any with this hotel. I stayed at three different hotels in Cambodia and Angkor Pearl had the best rates and was overall the best hotel hands down. I highly recommend Angkor Pearl if you are going to be in the Siem Reap area.
reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND ANGKOR PEARL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent two nights here in Jan. It was a great little hotel, neatly decorated, nice rooms, and very friendly staff. We were even given a glass of juice when we arrived. The hotel is very close to the main shopping street and within easy walking distance to a couple markets. It also has free internet to use in the main lobby.
reviews.title: Great value and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel also had a good breakfast, several things to choose from, all a good value. You just sit at the table, they will serve you, and then when we checked out they asked us how many breakfasts we had eaten. If we ever visit again, we would stay at this hotel and recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Cambodia!
reviews.title: Perfect location for Angkor, very good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights after reading report on tripadvisor. It is a great hotel, really quite grand for the price! We had dinner here once, which was very tasty and well priced. The breakfast was from a set menu and was good. There were a couple of computers in the bar which were free to use. There was a big tv and sky in the bedroom and a great shower.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a great price

reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful and very easily arranged a tuktuk driver to take us around the temples. We had Sam, who was great. He was very relaxed, not pushy at all, his english was great and we had a great couple of days with him. I would book him, if you can. You can find him at Sam tuktuk on Facebook or samtuktuk@yahoo.com.
reviews.title: A great hotel...with a great tuk tuk driver!!

reviews.text: The only bad experience we had with the hotel was that they did not pick us up from the bus station, as arranged. But, to be fair, i think this was due to a miscommunication by email. They offered to pay for a tuktuk when we went home, which we didn't need in the end.
reviews.title: great accommodation by Angkor Pearl staff.

reviews.text: All in all, great stay and a great hotel.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although there was a mix up which did affect my first impression, the stay at the Angkor Hotel was absolutely delightful.
reviews.title: Great place, great price

description: New Team New Services New facilities New ways to Make you smile Oct. 2011. New and improved Angkor Pearl ensuring the best value in Cambodian Hotels. At Angkor Pearl Hotel, we pride ourselves on quality of service on a genuinely high level and an emphasis on catering to our guest’s every need with courtesy and warmth. Angkor Pearl Hotel is Cambodian owned, operated, and managed by Cambodian Americans since February of 2010. The story behind the pearl dates back years when Cambodia gained independence from France and King Sihanouk called the Capitol "The Pearl of Asia." Hence, we call ourselves The Pearl of Siem Reap. The Angkor Pearl Hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Siem Reap. A brisk 10 minute walk lead you to the center market where you can shop for food, clothes, souvenirs, and many more. Getting to the Temples is just as easy. A scenic 15 minute drive will take you back in time to the Khmer civilization where you will discover all of Angkor’s natural beauty.
